0.title: What are the punishments & fines imposed on Yasin Malik by NIA court?
0.article_body: Kashmiri separatist leader Yasin Malik was sentenced to life imprisonment and fined ₹10 lakh for offence under Section 17 of UAPA. For offences under Section 121 of IPC, court awarded him life imprisonment and ₹10,000 fine. He also received jail term of 10 years and ₹10,000 fine each for violating Sections 120B, 121A of IPC, Sections 18, 20 of UAPA.

1.title: Clip of Karan Johar's acting debut from 1989 goes viral on his b'day
1.article_body: A video of a 15-year-old Karan Johar making his acting debut has gone viral on social media. The clip is from a 1989 TV show called 'Indradhanush' which also featured Urmila Matondkar. Twitter users shared the clip on the filmmaker's 50th birthday. Karan made his acting debut in Bollywood with Shah Rukh Khan's 'Dilwale Dulhania Le Jayenge' in 1995.

2.title: Ukraine's Prez offers condolences over Texas school shooting
2.article_body: Ukraine's President Volodymyr Zelenskyy has offered his condolences to the families of the 21 people who were killed in a shooting at a school in US' Texas. "This is terrible to have victims of shooters in peaceful times," he said. The 18-year-old suspected attacker, who shot and killed the 21 people, including 19 students, was later shot dead by police.

3.title: 42-yr-old K'taka man clears Class 10 exam after 28 yrs along with son
3.article_body: A 42-year-old man, Rahmathulla, in Karnataka passed Class 10 exam with 333 marks after three failed attempts in the last 28 years. His son also cleared the exam and scored 98% marks. Rahmathulla said his son used to teach him after he returned home from work. "This was really one of the biggest moments of my life," he added.

4.title: Which are the top 10 companies in America as per Fortune 500 list?
4.article_body: Walmart has topped the 68th edition of the Fortune 500 ranking of America's largest companies, with $572 billion revenue. It is followed by Amazon and Apple, with $469 billion and $365 billion revenue respectively. The list also features CVS Health, UnitedHealth Group and Exxon Mobil. Berkshire Hathaway, Alphabet, McKesson and AmerisourceBergen are the other companies in the top 10.

5.title: Asaduddin Owaisi is destroying the country like Jinnah: BJP MP
5.article_body: BJP MP Harnath Singh Yadav said that AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi is doing the same work of destroying the country that Muhammad Ali Jinnah did before Independence. Accusing Owaisi of trying to mislead the Muslim community, he said, "If Owaisi does not stop the act of breaking the country, then he will have to spend time in the jail only."

6.title: 10 arrested as fake job racket busted in Noida, ₹6 lakh recovered
6.article_body: Police said that they busted a fake job racket in Noida and arrested 10 people for allegedly cheating people with fake job offers. The suspects cheated over 50 people to the tune of ₹20 crore in the last couple of years, the police said. They added that seven laptops, 17 mobile phones and ₹6.74 lakh cash were recovered from them.

7.title: LSG to bowl first against RCB in Eliminator, playing XIs announced
7.article_body: Lucknow Super Giants (LSG) captain KL Rahul won the toss and elected to bowl first against Royal Challengers Bangalore (RCB) in IPL 2022 Eliminator on Wednesday. LSG have made two changes to their playing XI, with Krunal Pandya and Dushmantha Chameera replacing Krishnappa Gowtham and Jason Holder, respectively. Mohammed Siraj has replaced Siddharth Kaul in RCB's playing XI.

8.title: India's Instagram users can now post 3D avatars in Stories, DMs
8.article_body: Instagram-parent Meta on Tuesday launched 3D virtual avatars to be used on Instagram Stories and direct messages (DMs) in India. Meta also released an update for its 3D avatars on Facebook and Messenger app in India, which allows users to create their own virtual selves. The updated avatars include cochlear implants and over-the-ear hearing aids.

9.title: Andhra signs deals worth $16 bn at WEF, to generate 38,000 jobs
9.article_body: Andhra Pradesh signed renewables investment pacts worth $16 billion (around ₹1.2 lakh crore) with  three companies, Adani Green Energy, Singapore's GIC sovereign wealth fund-backed Greenko and Aurobindo Realty & Infrastructure, during the WEF at Davos. The pacts involve setting up  hydro, solar and wind power related projects in the state. The investments will create 38,000 jobs, an official said.

10.title: 2 Naxals carrying ₹12 lakh reward surrender before Maha Police
10.article_body: Two Naxals carrying a collective reward of ₹12 lakh on their heads surrendered before the Gadchiroli police in Maharashtra, officials said. The Naxals were allegedly involved in various killings, arson and encounters, the officials said. In a press release, Gadchiroli Superintendent of Police Ankit Goyal said that from 2019 till date, 49 hardcore Naxalites have surrendered before him.

11.title: Man beats 22-yr-old wife to death after an argument in Thane
11.article_body: Police said that a man allegedly thrashed his 22-year-old wife to death with a wooden log after a domestic dispute in Maharashtra's Thane district. The incident took place on Tuesday evening and the 28-year-old accused, Shankar Waghmare, was arrested in the early hours of Wednesday, the police said. The accused has been booked under IPC Section 302 (murder), they added.

12.title: Denmark may give vaccines to close contacts of monkeypox cases: Report
12.article_body: Denmark is considering providing vaccines to close contacts of those who have been infected with monkeypox, Reuters reported quoting the Danish Health Authority. This comes after Denmark confirmed two monkeypox cases in individuals with travel history to Spain. As many as 20 countries, including the US, UK, Israel, Portugal and Switzerland have reported monkeypox cases.

13.title: I want death penalty for him: IAF martyr's wife as Yasin gets life term
13.article_body: The wife of Air Force officer Ravi Khanna, martyred in a terror attack allegedly carried out by Jammu and Kashmir separatist leader Yasin Malik, said she wasn't satisfied with life imprisonment awarded to him. "I want...death penalty for him in my case," said Nirmal Khanna. A Delhi court has sentenced Malik to life imprisonment in a 2017 terror funding case.

14.title: Yasin Malik's supporters clash with security personnel, pelt stones in Srinagar
14.article_body: Several supporters of Yasin Malik clashed with security personnel and pelted stones outside his residence in Srinagar on Wednesday. The security personnel fired tear gas during the protest, which was held ahead of Malik's sentencing. He has been sentenced to life imprisonment in terror funding case by an NIA court in Delhi.

15.title: World's shortest living teenager confirmed as 17-year-old from Nepal, pics released
15.article_body: Dor Bahadur Khapangi (Nepal) has officially been confirmed as the shortest teenager living (male). Khapangi, born on 14 November 2004, is now 17 years old. The measurement took place on 23 March 2022 in Kathmandu, Nepal. Khapangi was confirmed to be an average height of 73.43 cm (2 ft 4.9 in), revealed Guinness World Records.

16.title: Relatives had cut several of my outfits with scissors: Urfi Javed
16.article_body: Urfi Javed recalled an incident when her relatives "took their anger" out on her clothes. "With a pair of scissors, they cut so many of my dresses, saying some showed cleavage while others were sleeveless," she stated. Urfi added most of those relatives now want a selfie with her. "I've always been bold and loved to dress well," she said.

17.title: Filmwaala was filmwaala in our time; not Hindu, Muslim, Sikh: Tanuja
17.article_body: Veteran actress Tanuja, talking about the progress in the film industry, has said that the film industry has become corporate "instead of being a family". "When you become corporate then it becomes very compartmentalized," she added. Tanuja further said, "In our time, filmwaala was just filmwaala...Not a Hindu, Muslim, or Sikh, just filmwaala."

18.title: China conducts military operations near Taiwan
18.article_body: China on Wednesday announced that it had held military operations near Taiwan. This comes after US President Joe Biden said that the US would defend Taiwan militarily if China invaded the self-ruled island. In response to Biden's remarks, China said that it's a "purely internal affair", adding, "Taiwan is an inalienable part of China's territory."

19.title: Thieves write 'I love you' on TV after ₹20 lakh theft from Goa home
19.article_body: Thieves broke into a bungalow in Goa and ran away with valuables worth ₹20 lakh. The robbers left an 'I love you' note using a marker on the television screen of the house in Margao town. The house owner had gone out on a two-day holiday when the accused ran away with gold and silver ornaments and cash.

20.title: Lynching-accused are punished in Pak, garlanded in India: Mufti
20.article_body: PDP chief Mehbooba Mufti on Wednesday compared the judiciaries of India and Pakistan in terms of treatment of lynching cases. "A man was lynched in Pakistan, they sentenced six people to death...Several [people] have been lynched [in India] after 2015...The accused [have been] garlanded, not punished," she said. "That's the difference between their judiciary and [ours]," Mufti added.

21.title: 2 Rafale fighter jets collide mid-air during airshow in France; video surfaces
21.article_body: A video has surfaced online, showing the moment two Rafale fighter jets collided mid-air during an airshow in France's Chateaubernard military base on Sunday. The top tail of one of the two jets got severed in the collision, but it managed to land safely. The part of the jet reportedly fell on a house and damaged its roof.

22.title: No petrol in any petrol station in Lahore, no cash in ATM: Ex-Pak cricketer Hafeez
22.article_body: Former Pakistan cricketer Mohammad Hafeez took to Twitter to give a glimpse of problems faced by the "common man" in Pakistan. "No petrol available in any petrol station in Lahore??? No cash available in ATM?? Why [does] a common man [have] to suffer from political decisions?" he wrote. He tagged former Pakistan PM Imran Khan and current PM Shehbaz Sharif.

23.title: We will fight back: Brother of dismissed Punjab Health Minister
23.article_body: After Punjab Health Minister Vijay Singla was dismissed by CM Bhagwant Mann and arrested for corruption, his elder brother said the family is taking the legal recourse to defend Singla. "There's a serious nefarious design to implicate Vijay...It's difficult to identify the perpetrators at the moment, but we'll fight back against the bid to tarnish my brother's image," he added.

24.title: J&K separatist leader Yasin Malik sentenced to life imprisonment in terror funding case
24.article_body: Jammu and Kashmir separatist leader Yasin Malik has been sentenced to life imprisonment in the 2017 terror funding case by a Delhi court on Wednesday. The NIA had sought death penalty for Malik, who was earlier convicted in the case by the court. Notably, Malik had pleaded guilty to all charges, including those under the Unlawful Activities (Prevention) Act.

25.title: My parents' split hasn't put me off idea of marriage: Shruti Haasan
25.article_body: Speaking about her parents Kamal Haasan and Sarika's marriage, Shruti Haasan said, "When it worked, they were a brilliant couple...that's what I chose to look at." She added that she wouldn't "write off the idea of marriage" just because of her parents' divorce. "It was a fantastic marriage and that's what I chose to take away from it," she stated.

26.title: TMC has culture of bringing Rohingyas: BJP leader Saumitra Khan
26.article_body: BJP leader Saumitra Khan on Wednesday accused the Trinamool Congress (TMC) of propagating "a culture of bringing Rohingyas" to sustain itself in the government in West Bengal. Khan had earlier sought a ban on TMC, alleging that the party is responsible for the influx of Rohingya refugees in India. He had also termed the TMC a "terror supply party".

27.title: 46 held for violence after houses of minister, MLA set afire in AP
27.article_body: Police have arrested 46 people in connection with the violence which broke out in Andhra Pradesh's Amalapuram town over the renaming of the newly created Konaseema district as BR Ambedkar Konaseema district. The houses of a state minister and an MLA were set on fire during Tuesday's violence. Meanwhile, police have tightened the security and deployed additional forces in Amalapuram.

28.title: India likely to get 'normal' monsoon rains this year: IMD
28.article_body: India is likely to get normal seasonal monsoon rainfall this year, said Jayanta Sarkar, Head, India Meteorological Department (IMD) Mumbai. Heatwave conditions are unlikely to prevail over the country and light to moderate rainfall is expected in Konkan and Goa region during the next five days, IMD said on Wednesday. Isolated heavy rainfall likely over some northeastern states, it added.

29.title: India-Pakistan not moving forward, but 1 day we'll engage economically: Pak Min
29.article_body: Pakistan Minister Bilawal Bhutto Zardari on Wednesday said that his country's relations with India have not been moving forward. "But one day we'll get to the position where international institutions will...ensure the international order. Definitely, there will be a day when we'll be able to engage with our neighbour to the east, not just diplomatically but also economically," he stated.

30.title: Shutdown in parts of Srinagar ahead of court verdict on Yasin Malik
30.article_body: Some areas in Jammu and Kashmir's Srinagar observed a shutdown on Wednesday as a court was scheduled to give a verdict on the quantum of sentence for separatist leader Yasin Malik, who has been convicted in a terror funding case. Some shops in Maisuma and Lal Chowk were closed. Security forces were deployed in strength to maintain law and order.

31.title: Coinbase becomes first crypto company to get listed on Fortune 500
31.article_body: Coinbase, the San Francisco-based crypto exchange, has become the first cryptocurrency company to break into the Fortune 500 list. Currently ranked at 437, Coinbase has a market value of $41,670 million and over 3,700 employees, as per Fortune. The exchange was singled out by Fortune editor-in-chief Alyson Shontell as one of "several pandemic winners".

32.title: Biden's approval rating falls to 36%, lowest of his presidency: Poll
32.article_body: As Americans suffered from rising inflation, US President Joe Biden's public approval rating fell to 36%, the lowest since he took office in January 2021, a Reuters/Ipsos opinion poll found. Around 59% of Americans disapproved of Biden's job performance, according to the two-day national poll. Biden's approval rating has been below 50% since August last year.

33.title: He likely moved from last call spot: Official on Delhi man's death in Pune
33.article_body: While talking about Delhi engineer who was found dead after he went missing in a forest in Pune, an official from group specialising in search and rescue, said the man seemingly moved away from location from where he made last call to his friend. The official also advised trekkers to stay at location of last call if they get lost.

34.title: Pune BJP MP supports locals protesting over civic garden's name
34.article_body: Pune BJP MP Girish Bapat on Wednesday extended support to Salisbury Park residents who have been protesting over the renaming of the civic garden. Former BJP corporator Shrinath Bhimale had in March put up a board naming the garden after his father, late Yashwantrao Bhimale. Residents of Salisbury Park have been protesting against it for the last two months.

35.title: Accused not linked to LeT: Lawyer of Pune man held in terror case
35.article_body: The lawyer of a Pune youth arrested on Tuesday by Maharashtra's Anti-Terrorism Squad (ATS) after being accused of having links to Lashkar-e-Taiba (LeT) stated that the youth, Mohammad Junaid, isn't linked to the terror outfit. The 28-year-old suspect has been "brainwashed" and "falsely implicated", the lawyer further said. Junaid has been sent to ATS' custody till June 3.

36.title: Hyderabad hospitals refunded ₹1.61 cr to 87 COVID patients: RTI reply
36.article_body: After complaints of overcharging COVID-19 patients, private hospitals in Hyderabad have refunded over ₹1.61 crore to 87 people between November 2020 and June 2021, as per a reply given to an RTI application. The Director of Public Health and Family Welfare had earlier issued guidelines on hospital tariffs. It had put a limit on various charges.

37.title: Cryptocurrency platform CoinTracker announces India foray
37.article_body: Cryptocurrency platform CoinTracker has announced its foray into the Indian market. Starting Wednesday, its crypto tax compliance and portfolio tracking products will be available to all crypto users in India. The dropping trading volumes and uncertain crypto regulations in India won't affect the firm as it's not dependent on users to have to transact a lot, said CEO Jon Lerner.

38.title: Prostitution racket busted at Bengaluru spa; 3 women rescued
38.article_body: Bengaluru City Police have busted a prostitution racket that was allegedly being operated from a spa centre, the city's Joint Commissioner of Police (Crime), Raman Gupta, said on Tuesday. Acting on a tip-off, police reportedly raided the spa centre, Zen Glow Salon Spa and Wellness, and busted the racket. Furthermore, police rescued three women from there and arrested one person.

39.title: We should give equal importance to each language of India: Ayushmann
39.article_body: Ayushmann Khurrana, speaking over the national language debate, has said, "We really can't keep one language at the forefront." He added India has multiple languages, multiple religions, regions, communities and ethnicities. "We should give equal importance to each language of our nation," he added. This comes after Ajay Devgn-Kiccha Sudeep's Twitter debate on Hindi being the national language.

40.title: Delhi HC rules out discrimination case by disabled person against Uber
40.article_body: Delhi High Court asked a complainant to delete Uber India from the list of parties named in his discrimination against persons with disability petition. As per Uber, the court said notice needed to be issued to the Centre alone as it'll implement the required directives. The petitioner had alleged an Uber driver refused to keep his wheelchair in his taxi.

41.title: 75 missing, 1 confirmed dead after migrant boat sinks off Tunisia
41.article_body: As many as 75 people went missing after a boat carrying migrants sank off Tunisia on Wednesday, according to the International Organization for Migration. It added that 24 people were rescued from the boat which had departed from Libya. The body of one person was found while the search was on for the others, said a Tunisian security official.

42.title: Narinder Batra resigns as Indian Olympic Association president
42.article_body: Narinder Batra has resigned from the post of Indian Olympic Association (IOA) president. Batra said he took the decision to focus on his role as President of International Hockey Federation (FIH) as "world hockey is going through an essential development phase". "I wish my successor and the whole sports family in India every success in the future!" he added.

43.title: Paramilitary officer hugs Adivi after watching 'Major', video surfaces
43.article_body: In a video that has surfaced online, a paramilitary officer can be seen talking to and hugging actor Adivi Sesh after watching his movie 'Major', that is based on life of Major Sandeep Unnikrishnan. The officer, who was in a wheelchair, can be seen showing Adivi how he got goosebumps after watching the film.

44.title: To the man who's my father & best friend: Alia on Karan Johar's 50th b'day
44.article_body: Actress Alia Bhatt wished Karan Johar on his 50th birthday. Taking to Instagram, she shared unseen photos with Karan from her wedding. Alongside the post, Alia wrote, "To the most generous soul I know...to the man who is my father...my best friend...and my mentor...Happy 50th birthday K! I pray and wish for only love, peace and joy in your life."

45.title: Steps taken to prevent waterlogging at critical spots in Delhi: PWD
45.article_body: Delhi's Public Works Department (PWD) has taken multiple steps to prevent waterlogging during monsoon at critical locations. At least seven critical spots which are prone to waterlogging have been identified out of 145 such locations, senior PWD officials said. The steps include construction of drains and sumps, installation of automated pumps and deployment of additional maintenance vans.

46.title: Will accept hanging if Intel proves my role in terror activities: Yasin Malik
46.article_body: As the National Investigation Agency has urged the court to give death penalty to Jammu and Kashmir separatist leader Yasin Malik, he said he'll accept the hanging if Indian Intelligence proved that he had been involved in any terrorist activity or violence in 28 years. "Then, I will also retire from politics," he said.

47.title: My fees was slashed in half as I played mute character, felt disrespected: Manoj
47.article_body: Actor Manoj Bajpayee recalled that he felt disrespected after his fee was slashed in half by a show's producer. Manoj said that filmmaker Anubhav Sinha cast him as a mute man for his show 'Shikast'. He added that when he went to collect his fees after four months, the producer said, "Payment is for dialogues, where are your dialogues?"

48.title: Lift sanctions & we'll allow ships with food to leave Ukraine: Russia
48.article_body: Russian Deputy Foreign Minister Andrey Rudenko said Russia is ready to provide a humanitarian corridor for vessels carrying food to leave Ukraine if some sanctions imposed on Moscow are lifted, Interfax reported. Ukraine's Black Sea ports have been blocked since Russia began invading Ukraine. The European Union has accused Russia of using food supplies as a weapon with global repercussions.

49.title: Check untreated waste being released in Ganga: NGT to U'khand govt
49.article_body: The National Green Tribunal (NGT) directed the Uttarakhand chief secretary to check discharge of untreated waste into Ganga. The direction came following a petition that claimed agents of municipal corporation in Rishikesh bathed and washed vehicles using the tap installed outside a toilet complex on the banks of river Ganga. NGT further ordered the chief secretary to take remedial action.

50.title: US Open champion Raducanu knocked out of French Open in 2nd round by world no. 47
50.article_body: US Open 2021 champion Emma Raducanu has been knocked out of the French Open 2022 in the second round. The 19-year-old lost the match 6-3, 1-6, 1-6 to world number 47 Aliaksandra Sasnovich of Belarus. Sasnovich has reached the third round of the Roland Garros for the first time in her career.

51.title: Wanted to respect the game even if we lose: Hardik on GT's win vs RR
51.article_body: Discussing GT's win by seven wickets against RR in IPL 2022's Qualifier 1, GT captain Hardik Pandya said, "We goofed up against MI and wanted to respect the game...even if we lose." "[I] wanted...[me, David Miller] to finish," added Hardik. Talking about his performances with the bat, Hardik stated he hasn't been successful batting at the position of his choice.

52.title: Captain Abhilasha becomes 1st woman officer to join Army Aviation Corps as Combat Aviator
52.article_body: Captain Abhilasha Barak has created history by becoming the first woman officer to join the Army Aviation Corps as Combat Aviator. "Captain Abhilasha Barak has been awarded the Coveted Wings along with 36 Army Pilots by Director General & Colonel Commandant Army Aviation," the Additional Directorate General of Public Information, IHQ of MoD (Army) tweeted on Wednesday.

53.title: Ate dumplings, that's it: Raducanu on celebrations after US Open 2021 win
53.article_body: Talking about the celebrations after she won the US Open in 2021, Great Britain's tennis player Emma Raducanu said, "There was nothing big or amazing that my parents did to celebrate." "We just came home and ate dumplings, and that was it. We are very normal," added Raducanu. Raducanu became the first-ever qualifier to win a Grand Slam title.

54.title: Chandigarh immigration firm owner cheats 15 people of ₹2.29 cr, booked
54.article_body: The owner of a Chandigarh-based immigration firm was booked for allegedly cheating at least 15 people of ₹2.29 crore on the pretext of sending their children abroad on student visas. The accused man took possession of their passports and original documents. Besides the main accused, seven other staff members from the office are under the scanner, police said.

55.title: Violence in TN town after burnt body of fisherwoman found near shrimp farm
55.article_body: The partially burnt body of a 47-year-old fisherwoman was found in an isolated area near a shrimp farm near Vadakadu fishing town in Tamil Nadu on Tuesday. Alleging the deceased was gang-raped and burnt, locals set the farm afire and attacked workers whom they suspected were behind the crime. They've been protesting near taluka office, seeking justice after the incident.

56.title: Satish Kaushik accuses Go First of using 'dubious ways to earn money', says got no refund
56.article_body: Satish Kaushik accused Go First airline of using "dubious ways" to earn money. Kaushik said his office booked two seats "in first row with middle seat" and paid ₹25,000. He alleged the flight sold middle seat to another passenger despite his office paying for it. Kaushik added his office has been contacting customer care and their reply was 'no refund'.

57.title: Pay more attention: Ethereum Co-founder on recent crypto crash
57.article_body: People must pay more attention to what is belying the currency name when they get involved, said Ethereum's Co-founder Gavin Wood with regard to the recent crypto crash which wiped $800 billion off their value. The crypto crash led to Terra's LUNA crypto token crashing nearly 100%. "The internet has no real concept of legality," Wood added.

58.title: People come & go from Congress: Venugopal on Kapil Sibal's exit
58.article_body: Reacting to ex-Union Minister Kapil Sibal's exit from Congress, party leader KC Venugopal said "people come and go" from Congress. "[Sibal] had already written a letter to...party president...[it said] that he firmly believed in...Congress' values," he stated. Sibal, who was affiliated with Congress for over 30 years, filed nomination for Rajya Sabha polls with Samajwadi Party's support today.

59.title: 6 civilians killed in Ukraine by Russian shelling: Governor
59.article_body: At least six civilians were killed by Russian shelling in Severodonetsk city in eastern Ukraine, Governor of the Luhansk region, Serhiy Haidai, said on Wednesday. Haidai added that another eight people were injured in the last 24 hours in the city. He claimed that the Russian forces were deliberately attacking the shelters where civilians were hiding.

60.title: IPL betting racket busted in B'luru; 1 held, over ₹2 lakh seized
60.article_body: Bengaluru City Police have busted an IPL betting racket, the city's Joint Commissioner of Police (Crime), Raman Gupta, said on Wednesday. Police have also arrested a man for his alleged involvement in illegal betting on a cricket match between SunRisers Hyderabad and Punjab Kings. Police have seized over ₹2,00,000 in cash, a mobile phone and other items from his possession.

61.title: Punjab govt hikes milk procurement prices by ₹55 per kg fat
61.article_body: The Punjab government announced an increase in milk procurement prices by ₹55 per kg fat for dairy farmers. The increase in milk procurement prices will not have any impact on retail milk prices, said Punjab minister Harpal Singh Cheema. This decision comes after dairy farmers held a massive protest at a state-owned milk plant in Mohali, seeking hike in price.

62.title: You'll always be in my heart: Sanjay on dad Sunil Dutt's death anniversary
62.article_body: Marking the death anniversary of his father, Sunil Dutt, actor Sanjay Dutt on Wednesday shared a post for him on his social media. Sharing a throwback picture of them, Sanjay wrote, "Through thick and thin, you were always there to guide and protect me. You were my strength...in every need...You will always be in my heart Dad, I miss you."

63.title: Assam man carries illegal weapons to SP office; arrested
63.article_body: Assam Police arrested a man from the Nagaon district on Wednesday for allegedly carrying illegal weapons to the office of Superintendent of Police (SP) Leena Doley. They also recovered a pistol, six bullets along with two mobile handsets from his possession. "Arrested man already has cases of extortion and dacoity filed against him," the SP said.

64.title: Many uniting for 2024: Sibal on filing RS nomination with SP’s support
64.article_body: After resigning from Congress and filing Rajya Sabha nomination with SP's support, Kapil Sibal on Wednesday said many people are coming together for 2024 when the Lok Sabha polls are scheduled to be held. "We, many people, are coming together for 2024. We will expose the shortcomings of the central government ahead of 2024," Sibal added.

65.title: Future plans are to unite Opposition to oppose BJP: Kapil Sibal
65.article_body: Soon after resigning from Congress, Kapil Sibal said that his future plans are to unite the Opposition to oppose the BJP. Sibal added that the BJP is following "anti-people policies" and is "dividing" the inclusive culture of India. "We (the Opposition) want to create an alliance so that we can oppose the (PM) Modi-led government," Sibal said after his resignation.

66.title: 9-ft-long alligator missing top half of its snout spotted in US; pic surfaces
66.article_body: A nine-foot-long alligator with missing top half of its snout was spotted in a lake in the US' Florida. "I saw this gator far away and he looked weird to me...The whole end of his top jaw is missing...By the looks of him, he's doing alright though," the woman who first spotted it said in a post.

67.title: Not everything is misleading like your birthdate: Mishra to Afridi for defending Yasin
67.article_body: Reacting to ex-Pakistan cricketer Shahid Afridi calling terror charges against Jammu and Kashmir separatist leader Yasin Malik "fabricated", cricketer Amit Mishra tweeted, "Dear Afridi...he himself has pleaded guilty in court on record." He added, "Not everything is misleading like your birthdate." Yasin was convicted in 2017 terror funding case by an NIA court in Delhi after he pleaded guilty.

68.title: Country Delight raises $108 million at $615 million valuation
68.article_body: D2C fresh foods brand Country Delight has raised $108 million in series D funding led by Venturi Partners and Temasek, at a valuation of $615 million. Others who participated in the round include, SWC Global and Trifecta Capital, IIFL Asset Management, Elevation Capital, Orios Venture Partners and Matrix Partners. The round takes the company's total funding to $147 million.

69.title: Delhi Transport Minister inaugurates 3 automated driving test tracks
69.article_body: Delhi government has started three automated driving tracks for people to take the test for obtaining their driving licence. Delhi Transport Minister Kailash Gahlot on Wednesday inaugurated the three tracks in Mayur Vihar, Shakur Basti and Vishwas Nagar. The tracks have been opened for people who are unable to spare time during the day, an official said.

70.title: Russian lawmakers pass bill to close 'unfriendly' foreign news outlets
70.article_body: Russian lower house of Parliament passed a bill giving prosecutors powers to shut foreign media outlets in Moscow if a nation has been "unfriendly" to Russian media. This follows the closure of some Russian state news outlets in the West. The bill needs to be reviewed by upper house of Parliament and signed by President Vladimir Putin to become law.

71.title: Had to handle kids during Mr India, now they say 'you were so strict': Satish
71.article_body: Actor Satish Kaushik said that he had the task of handling all the children who were part of 'Mr India'. "I had to train the children for the performances, I nearly took a whip to them to collect them. Now they say, 'Satish uncle, you were so strict.' I used to shout at them during the shooting also," he added.

72.title: Producers didn't want to work with me, it changed post 'The Kashmir...': Darshan
72.article_body: Actor Darshan Kumaar, who was recently seen in 'The Kashmir Files', spoke about how things changed after the film's success at the box office. He said, "Directors were always keen on working with me but the producers weren't ready to commit." "Earlier...the same people who didn't want to invest in my...projects are now casting me as...lead in films," he added.

73.title: Sandalwood smuggler Veerappan's elder brother dies at hospital in Salem
73.article_body: Madhaiyan, the elder brother of sandalwood smuggler Veerappan, died of a cardiac arrest at a hospital in Salem on Wednesday morning, police said. Madhaiyan was admitted to the hospital on May 1 following complaints of severe chest pain. He had been sentenced to a life term in connection with the murder of a forest ranger in 1987.

74.title: Centre trying to impose Gujarat-model everywhere: Mehbooba Mufti
74.article_body: PDP chief Mehbooba Mufti criticised the central government by saying that the Centre is trying to indulge in "communal politics" and impose Gujarat-model everywhere as it has nothing to offer to youths. "If Centre has strategies like Hitler against the Muslims then it should have the courage to reveal what they want to do with them at once," Mufti added.

75.title: Waited for 6-7 hours, he was busy: Ayushmann on why he couldn't meet SRK
75.article_body: Actor Ayushmann Khurrana opened up about what would've been his first-ever meeting with actor Shah Rukh Khan. He said, "I remember our first meeting. I was doing radio and I had to interview him. I couldn't interview him because he was shooting for...ad film." "I waited for 6-7 hours...he was busy. I had to...go back to the studio," he added.

76.title: Ashwin keeps proving people wrong, has been a revolution for RR: Jaffer
76.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Wasim Jaffer said all-rounder Ravichandran Ashwin has been a revolution for RR in IPL 2022, adding that he keeps on proving people wrong. "Whatever the role you put him in, you find him acing that well," stated Jaffer. Ashwin currently has a strike rate of 146.82 in IPL 2022. He has picked 11 wickets so far.

77.title: Delhi civic body releases 1 month's salary, pension of all employees
77.article_body: Municipal Corporation of Delhi has released one month's salary and pension of all employees and pensioners, officials said on Tuesday. "The corporation has made a fund of ₹432.84 crore available for this purpose," a senior MCD official said. The teachers of municipal schools had not been paid salaries for the past six months, AAP had alleged.

78.title: 21-yr-old man beaten to death by girlfriend’s family in Madhya Pradesh
78.article_body: A 21-year-old man was allegedly beaten to death by his girlfriend's family members after they caught the duo in an objectionable state in a field, a police official in Madhya Pradesh's Indore said on Tuesday. The body of the deceased, identified as Vinod Chouhan, was found in the Khudail area. "The girl's parents and brother are missing," police said.

79.title: KSRTC bus conductor slaps woman after argument in B'luru; arrested
79.article_body: Police have arrested a Karnataka State Road Transport Corporation (KSRTC) bus conductor for allegedly assaulting a 39-year-old woman passenger near Dasarahalli bus stand in Bengaluru. According to a report, the conductor allegedly slapped the woman after a heated argument broke out between them on Tuesday. Meanwhile, some senior KSRTC officials met the woman and apologised to her for the incident.

80.title: 'Sorry' painted in red, bold letters all over school and street in Bengaluru; pics surface
80.article_body: Miscreants painted 'sorry' in red, bold letters all over the premises of a school and nearby street in Bengaluru, pictures of which have surfaced online. "Two bike-borne persons were seen in the CCTV footage. Efforts on to identify and trace them," police said. The school authorities have not filed any complaint, according to reports.

81.title: Why shouldn't BJP be an option: Hardik Patel after quitting Congress
81.article_body: When asked if the Bharatiya Janata Party is an option for him after resigning from Congress, Hardik Patel said, "Why shouldn't it be?" When asked if he has an offer from a party, he said, "Offers and bargains are for weak people...Strong people create a space for themselves." Patel also added there is no clarity about where he will go.

82.title: Woman finds diamond worth ₹10 lakh in Madhya Pradesh mine
82.article_body: A woman named Chameli Bai has found a 2.08-carat diamond in a mine she took on lease in Madhya Pradesh's Panna district, said Anupam Singh, an official from diamond office. It may fetch up to ₹10 lakh in auction, he said. It will be put up for sale and the price will be fixed as per government guidelines, he added.

83.title: What are gun laws in US' Texas as 18-yr-old kills 19 kids at school?
83.article_body: According to gun laws in US' Texas, to carry a handgun in public without a license, a person must be at least 21 years old and shouldn't have a prior felony conviction. The laws do not specifically put restrictions on who can carry a long gun such as rifle. On Tuesday, an 18-year-old killed 19 students at a Texas school.

84.title: Anthony Russo & I are Dhanush fans: 'The Gray Man' director Joe Russo
84.article_body: 'The Gray Man' director Joe Russo, speaking about actor Dhanush, has said, "Anthony [Russo] and I are Dhanush's fans." "We wrote this role specifically for him. He's a...classic badass character, who shows up to combat the hero and complicate the film," Joe added. The filmmaker added Dhanush plays a top assassin and has "two incredible fights" in 'The Gray Man'.

85.title: Meeting someone abroad is act of courtesy: Tharoor on Rahul-Corbyn meet
85.article_body: Following Congress leader Rahul Gandhi and British MP Jeremy Corbyn's meet, Congress' Shashi Tharoor said meeting someone abroad is an act of courtesy. "It does not imply endorsement of all his ideas and views," Tharoor tweeted. "When visiting a democracy, meeting leaders from Opposition parties is a normal process, especially when the visitor is from a democracy too," Tharoor added.

86.title: Climate change causing people to sleep less, finds study
86.article_body: According to a study, by 2099, about 50-58 hours of sleep per person per year could be reduced due to climate change. People tend to sleep around 14 minutes less every day as the temperatures rise, the study that analysed sleep data of over 47,000 people stated. "The probability of having...short night...sleep increased as nights became hotter," a researcher said.

87.title: Fewer Indians use newspapers, magazines, radio and TV: NFHS
87.article_body: Fewer Indians use traditional mass media like newspapers, magazines, radio and TV for news and entertainment, a comparison of 2019-21 data by National Family Health Survey (NFHS) to that of 2015-16 showed. While 25% of women and 14% of men said they were not regularly exposed to mass media in 2015-2016, the trend rose to 41% and 32% in 2019-21.

88.title: Heartbroken: Pope on Texas school shooting, calls for weapon control
88.article_body: Pope Francis said that he's "heartbroken" by the shooting at a school in US' Texas that claimed lives of 21 people, including 19 students, on Wednesday. "It's time to say 'enough' to...indiscriminate trafficking of weapons. Let us all make a commitment so that tragedies like this cannot happen again," he added. The 18-year-old suspected attacker was shot dead by police.

89.title: Cabinet approves sale of govt's stake in Hindustan Zinc: Report
89.article_body: The Union Cabinet has approved sale of the Centre's entire residual stake in Hindustan Zinc Limited, Moneycontrol reported citing CNBC Awaaz. The government owns a 29.5% stake in the mining company, while Vedanta Limited holds a 64.92% stake. At current market price, the government's residual stake in Hindustan Zinc is valued at around ₹38,740 crore.

90.title: Advanced economies to be back on track by 2024: IMF's Gopinath
90.article_body: International Monetary Fund's First Deputy MD Gita Gopinath on Wednesday said advanced economies will be back on track by 2024, but developing economies would be 5% below where they would've been otherwise. "Prices of commodities including fuel and food are going up around the world," Gopinath said. Central banks are trying to tackle this high level of inflation, she added.

91.title: Prez Kovind to attend anniversary celebrations in Pune's Datta Mandir
91.article_body: President Ram Nath Kovind will on Friday attend the launch of the 125th-anniversary celebrations of the Laxmibai Dagdusheth Halwai Datta Mandir Trust in Pune. Former President Pratibha Patil will also be present on the occasion, the trust's head Pratap Pardeshi said. The event will be attended by Governor Bhagat Singh Koshyari and Deputy Chief Minister Ajit Pawar.

92.title: Sri Lankan PM sworn in as Finance Minister amid economic crisis
92.article_body: Sri Lankan PM Ranil Wickremesinghe was sworn in as Finance, Economic Stabilisation and National Policies Minister before President Gotabaya Rajapaksa on Wednesday, the President's office announced. Wickremesinghe will now lead talks with the International Monetary Fund (IMF) as the crisis-hit country seeks a bailout. The country is undergoing its worst economic crisis since independence in 1948.

93.title: Why am I called a Bengali actress, why not an Indian actress: Swastika
93.article_body: Amid the ongoing language debate in Indian cinema, Swastika Mukherjee questioned those using the term Bengali actress instead of Indian actress. She said, "What's 'Bengali actress'? Does anyone write 'Hindi actress' for those whose mother tongue is Hindi? Does every actor working in Bollywood hail from Mumbai?" "What's your problem with referring [to] people as Indian actresses?" she added.

94.title: Two top execs of Singapore-based Grab's fintech unit quit: Report
94.article_body: Singapore-based Grab's Chris Yeo, Head of GrabPay and GrabRewards, is leaving along with Jeffrey Goh, who leads its payments gateway business, Reuters reported citing sources. The exits follow Grab reporting a loss of $3.6 billion in 2021 from $2.7 billion a year earlier. Yeo has been with the firm for nearly six years.

95.title: Delhi HC acquits 5 molestation-murder convicts giving benefit of doubt
95.article_body: Delhi High Court has acquitted five molestation-murder convicts giving them the benefit of doubt. The court added that the testimony of the eyewitness was not truthful in connection with a case of molestation and murder of a woman in Uttam Nagar in March 2014. The appellant had been awarded a life sentence in 2019 by the trial court.

96.title: DNA samples sought from parents to identify some victims in Texas school shooting
96.article_body: Some of the parents of 19 children shot dead in an elementary school shooting in US' Texas have been asked to give their DNA samples to identify the victims, local media reported. A journalist also shared a video of the parents, stating that they were going one by one to get swabbed by investigators. The 18-year-old gunman was shot dead.

97.title: 19 kids killed by 18-yr-old shooter at US school were 2 days away from summer break
97.article_body: The 19 kids killed at a school in US' Texas were two days away from their summer break. The school serves about 570 children in second through fourth grades, nearly 90% of them Hispanic. Salvador Ramos shot his grandmother before fleeing and crashing his car near Robb Elementary School in Uvalde and killing at least 21 people.

98.title: ED books Karti Chidambaram for money laundering in Chinese visa case
98.article_body: The Enforcement Directorate (ED) has booked Congress MP Karti Chidambaram and others in connection with a money laundering case related to issuance of visas to 263 Chinese nationals in 2011. The agency said that it filed the case taking cognisance of an FIR by CBI in the matter. Chidambaram and his associate have been accused of taking ₹50 lakh bribe.

99.title: Mohali woman consumes poison & dies, husband booked for abetment
99.article_body: A man has been booked by Phase 11 police in Mohali for abetment to suicide after his wife consumed poison and died. Her father said in his complaint that his daughter consumed poison under stress as her husband demanded money from her to buy a car. The deceased woman was married for around a year and a half.

100.title: I wish I had played at least some cricket in childhood: Anushka on 'Chakda..'
100.article_body: Actress Anushka Sharma took to her Instagram Stories to share her picture while preparing for her upcoming movie 'Chakda 'Xpress'. "I wish I had played at least some cricket in my childhood, perhaps then I would not have suffered like this today," she wrote. Anushka will be playing cricketer Jhulan Goswami in the movie.

101.title: BJP leaders detained in Andhra over protest to rename Jinnah Tower
101.article_body: Several BJP members, including National Secretary Sunil Deodhar, were detained by police on Tuesday in Andhra Pradesh's Guntur. They reportedly marched towards the Jinnah Tower, demanding that the tower be renamed after India's former President Dr APJ Abdul Kalam. Condemning the arrests, BJP Rajya Sabha member GVL Narasimha Rao tweeted, "Wondering if we're in AP [Andhra Pradesh] or in Pakistan?"

102.title: Was asked 'When will you go to your country': Northeastern actress Andrea
102.article_body: Actress Andrea Kevichusa, who is from Nagaland, recalled a make-up artist being unaware that the state was a part of India. "I was probably about 16 years of age and I remember telling the makeup artist that I have a flight to Nagaland...And she was like, 'Oh is it? When are you going back to your country?'" she added.

103.title: Gujarat govt to soon launch India's first carbon trading market
103.article_body: Gujarat government has announced plans for setting up India's first cap-and-trade market for carbon emissions. The market will help industries that are unable to meet their emission targets to trade and purchase surplus targets from other industries which have met their goals. Gujarat government has also been running the world's first Emissions Trading Market for Particulate Pollution since 2019.

104.title: E-bus breaks down in Delhi hrs after being flagged off by Kejriwal
104.article_body: Just a few hours after Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal flagged off 150 electric buses on Tuesday, one of the new e-buses broke down near a Rohini bus depot, a report said. Meanwhile, Delhi Transport Corporation said the bus stopped automatically after its temperature rose beyond the specified limit. "[Response] team...attended the bus...put it on road within two hours," DTC added.

105.title: Manchester United owners in talks to buy East Bengal: Sourav Ganguly
105.article_body: Manchester United owners are in talks to buy East Bengal, one of the oldest football clubs in India, BCCI President Sourav Ganguly confirmed. "We've spoken to them and others also. It will take 10-12 more days to know who will be the entity," Ganguly added. In April, East Bengal's then owners Shree Cement had terminated the contract with the club.

106.title: Stuck from 3 hrs, no breakfast: SpiceJet flyer as he shares video amid ransomware attack
106.article_body: After SpiceJet said flights are operating normally following an attempted ransomware attack, a passenger refuted its claim. "We're stuck...since 3 hrs and 45 mins? Neither cancelling nor operating, sitting in the flight...No breakfast, no response!" the Twitter user wrote while sharing a video. "Who says the flights have normalised...People waiting from 6 am," another tweet read.

107.title: Helmets to be mandatory for pillion riders in Mumbai from June 9
107.article_body: Mumbai Traffic Police has made it mandatory for both the rider and pillion rider to wear helmets while riding a two-wheeler. Helmets will be made compulsory for cyclists as well, a circular said, adding the new rule will be implemented after 15 days from now. Violators will be fined ₹500 and their driving licence will be suspended for three months.

108.title: Air patrol with Russia not directed at any country: China
108.article_body: China said the joint aerial patrol conducted with Russia on Tuesday over the Sea of Japan, East China Sea, and Western Pacific wasn't directed at any country. The patrol, first since the Russian invasion of Ukraine, was part of an annual military exercise, China's Defence Ministry said. The exercise took place as leaders of the Quad group met in Tokyo.

109.title: It's not like Kohli isn't scoring runs at all like Rohit: Manjrekar
109.article_body: Cricketer-turned-commentator Sanjay Manjrekar said Virat Kohli was scoring 30s and half-centuries previously as well, unlike Rohit Sharma who is not scoring runs at all. "Somewhere the fans knew that he wasn't in form yet," added Manjrekar. Rohit scored 268 runs in IPL 2022 which did not include a single half-century. Kohli has scored 309 runs in IPL 2022 so far.

110.title: Reduce VAT on fuel prices: Tamil Nadu BJP chief urges DMK govt
110.article_body: Tamil Nadu BJP chief K Annamalai on Tuesday urged DMK-led state government to reduce VAT on fuel prices. He claimed that the state's VAT is higher than the excise duty imposed by Centre. "[DMK]...assured to reduce ₹5 per litre on petrol and ₹4 per litre for diesel," Annamalai stated, adding that the government failed to fulfil its 2021 poll promise.

111.title: Jamun price soars to ₹280/kg in Navi Mumbai's retail market
111.article_body: The price of jamun or black plum touched ₹280/kg in Navi Mumbai. "Earlier, the fruit was not much in demand. But after citizens got to know its medical benefits, the demand has gone up," a trader said. According to an APMC trader, arrival of jamun is not consistent as they are not grown like other fruits, leading to price rise.

112.title: Not easy to leave a relationship of 30-31 years: Kapil Sibal on quitting Congress
112.article_body: After revealing he has resigned from Congress party on May 16, former Union Minister Kapil Sibal on Wednesday said, "It's not easy to leave a relationship of 30-31 years." He added, "I'll not say anything about Congress. I've resigned, so it's not appropriate for me to say anything." Sibal filed nomination for the Rajya Sabha elections as an Independent candidate.

113.title: NASA shares InSight lander's last selfie taken on Mars
113.article_body: NASA has shared its InSight Mars lander's final selfie, which the lander took on April 24. In the selfie, the lander is covered with far more dust than it was in its first selfie, taken in 2018. The team will soon put InSight's robotic arm in its resting position (called the "retirement pose") for the last time in May 2022.

114.title: 3 arrested, 4 other juveniles booked for murder attempt in Pune
114.article_body: Pune's Hadapsar Police on Tuesday arrested three individuals and booked four other juveniles for their alleged involvement in an attempted murder case. The accused had allegedly attacked a 19-year-old kiosk owner in the city's Kalepadal area on Sunday. According to the police, the group attacked the victim to avenge the murder of one of their associates last month.

115.title: 1 policeman martyred, 3 terrorists killed in J&K's Baramulla encounter
115.article_body: While three Pakistani terrorists were killed, one Jammu and Kashmir policeman was martyred during an encounter in the Baramulla district, which began on Wednesday morning, police said. Incriminating materials, including arms and ammunition, were also recovered in the operation, Inspector General of Police, Kashmir zone, Vijay Kumar tweeted.

116.title: Crocodile tears: BJP after Kejriwal says Mann's action brought tears
116.article_body: Reacting to AAP chief Arvind Kejriwal's "brought tears to my eyes" statement after Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann sacked a minister over corruption charges, BJP spokesperson Gaurav Bhatia said, "These are crocodile tears and the country is ashamed of it." "When your own minister involves in corruption and gets caught for his sin, what is so proud of this?" Bhatia added.

117.title: Got such a character that nobody dared to step near me: Urvashi on Komolika
117.article_body: Talking about her character of Komolika in TV serial 'Kasautii Zindagii Kay', actress Urvashi Dholakia said, "I got such a character [that nobody dared to step near me]." "I didn't get any offers...after playing that character," added Urvashi. She stated that producer Ekta Kapoor had told her, the character would make her the next sex bomb of television industry.

118.title: Kohli-backed Digit Insurance targets $5 bn in IPO valuation: Report
118.article_body: Virat Kohli-backed fintech startup Digit Insurance is planning to raise about $500 million in an IPO at a valuation of $4.5 billion to $5 billion, Reuters reported citing sources. It plans to file its draft documents to SEBI by September and list by January. Digit was valued at close to $4 billion earlier this month.

119.title: People in courtroom laugh as Depp's witness denies being his fan, video viral
119.article_body: In a video shared online, people in courtroom can be heard bursting into laughter as Johnny Depp's witness in the ongoing defamation case said that he is not a fan of the actor. In the video, the witness also started to further elaborate his answer, after which, he was stopped and told that he was only asked one question.

120.title: I was in college when I witnessed the pain of north-east people: Ayushmann
120.article_body: Actor Ayushmann Khurrana said he was in college when he first witnessed "the pain of north-east people". "I must be 19, we had a Manipuri guy who called me 'Mayang' (it means an outsider)," he added. "I asked him why he does so and he told me 'You guys treat us as outsiders, so we'll call you outsiders'," Ayushmann said.

121.title: Maharashtra minister Nawab Malik's wife, sons skipped multiple summons: ED
121.article_body: Maharashtra minister Nawab Malik’s wife and their two sons skipped multiple summons by the Enforcement Directorate (ED) to join the probe in connection with a money laundering case, the ED stated in its charge sheet. Malik's wife was summoned twice while his son, Faraj Malik, was summoned five times in connection with the case, the ED stated.

122.title: Newborn, found alive hour after being buried, dies at Srinagar hospital
122.article_body: A newborn girl, who was found alive an hour after her burial, died at a Srinagar hospital on Wednesday morning, officials said. The baby was initially declared dead after being born, following which her family buried her at graveyard in Banihal. However, after villagers objected to her burial, the family dug up her grave during which she was found alive.

123.title: Indian civil officer counters Rahul Gandhi at Cambridge University; video goes viral
123.article_body: Indian civil service officer Siddhartha Verma countered Congress leader Rahul Gandhi at the University of Cambridge, a video of which has now gone viral. Verma tweeted, "I questioned Mr Rahul Gandhi on his statement that 'India is not a nation but a Union of States'. He asserted that India is not a nation but the result of negotiation between states."

124.title: TVF founder Arunabh marries girlfriend Shruti after dating for 10 years, shares pics
124.article_body: The Viral Fever (TVF) founder Arunabh Kumar tied the knot with his girlfriend Shruti Ranjan after dating for 10 years. Sharing pictures on Instagram, Arunabh and Shruti wrote, "We tied the knot of holy matrimony a while back in presence of our immediate family members...We look forward to a journey ahead full of love & light."

125.title: Underage girl can abort without parental consent if raped: Mexico's Supreme Court
125.article_body: Mexico's Supreme Court has ruled that an underage girl can get an abortion without parental consent if she has been raped. The court said it was not necessary to file a crime report about the rape and the victim only has to swear she was raped. Last year, the court held that it was unconstitutional to punish abortion.

126.title: Value of crypto raised by Ukraine falls amid crypto market fall
126.article_body: The value of cryptocurrency raised by Ukraine has fallen amid a drop in cryptocurrencies in recent weeks. On March 19, the "Aid for Ukraine" fund said it had raised cryptocurrency worth over $60 million. Two months later, on May 19, the total value was $51.5 million. Ukraine was able to spend $45 million on its army before the crash.

127.title: 160 liquor vends auctioned in Gurugram east, ₹568 cr collected
127.article_body: The Haryana government auctioned 160 liquor vends in Gurugram east on Tuesday through e-tenders and earned ₹568 crore, said the excise department officials. The reserve price, which is the lowest price at which the department is willing to auction the liquor shop, was kept at ₹432 crore. The highest bid received was ₹35 crore for a shop in Sector 40.

128.title: Yash can't do smaller movies, will only do pan-Indian films: 'KGF' producer
128.article_body: Vijay Kiragandur, who is the producer of actor Yash-starrers 'K.G.F' and 'K.G.F: Chapter 2', said Yash has become a big Indian star, adding that he has set huge targets and has to beat his own targets now. "He's going to do only pan-Indian movies...He has reached that level. So he can't do any smaller movies in future," stated Vijay.

129.title: Police attacked by Nigerian national during drug raid on his cafe in B'luru
129.article_body: A 44-year-old Nigerian national has been arrested for allegedly assaulting the police when they raided his cafe to recover drugs in Bengaluru's Chikka Banaswadi on Saturday. According to the police, the accused, Elvis Kayine, attacked them with a liquor bottle, injuring three police constables. The entire act was recorded by one of the persons who helped the police arrest Elvis.

130.title: Man sentenced to 8 yrs in jail for raping 15-yr-old girl in Jammu in 2014
130.article_body: A fast-track court in Jammu sentenced a man to eight years of rigorous imprisonment for raping a 15-year-old girl in 2014. His co-accused was sentenced to four months in jail. According to the prosecution, the girl was returning home when the men forcefully kidnapped her, took her to an unknown place from the Gho Manhasan road and sexually assaulted her.

131.title: 6 tourists from WB killed, 31 injured as bus overturns in Odisha
131.article_body: At least six tourists from West Bengal's Howrah were killed and 31 others were injured when the bus in which they were travelling overturned in Odisha's Kalinga Ghati on Tuesday night, police said. The bus was carrying 76 passengers to Andhra Pradesh's Visakhapatnam, police added. The bus hit an electric pole before overturning after the driver lost control, police stated.

132.title: Man robbed of gold chain & phone by couple on Pune-Mumbai highway
132.article_body: A man was allegedly robbed of a gold chain worth ₹2 lakh and a cell phone worth ₹19,499 by a couple at knifepoint on the Pune-Mumbai highway on Tuesday. The incident took place when Vishal Pangarkar stopped near a petrol pump on the highway to attend nature's call at around 5 am. Police have launched an investigation into the incident.

133.title: Was asked to give brotherhood message after Babri case: Ghai on 'Pyaar Ki...'
133.article_body: While talking about the song 'Pyaar Ki Ganga Bahe', filmmaker Subhash Ghai said after the Babri Masjid was demolished, he got call from the Ministry of Information and Broadcasting, asking if film industry can send out a message of brotherhood. "I agreed...The atmosphere in the country was very charged...People were dying in communal clashes and everyone was disturbed," he added.

134.title: Locals hold funeral for monkey after it dies of electrocution in MP
134.article_body: The residents of Teonthar town in Madhya Pradesh on Monday held a traditional funeral for a monkey that died due to electrocution after the civic officials and forest department refused to cremate the animal. A video of the funeral procession with a music band showing a man holding the monkey's carcass with garlands also reportedly went viral on social media.

135.title: Russian invasion of Ukraine may be start of World War III: Soros
135.article_body: Billionaire investor George Soros on Tuesday said the Russian invasion of Ukraine "may have been the beginning of the Third World War and our civilisation may not survive it". "The best and perhaps only way to preserve our civilisation is to defeat [Russian President Vladimir] Putin as soon as possible," he added, while speaking at World Economic Forum in Davos.

136.title: 2 men kill friend in MP for not ensuring early bail in criminal case, held
136.article_body: Two men in Madhya Pradesh's Jabalpur allegedly killed their friend for not ensuring an early bail in a criminal case. Jaideep Rathore had been imprisoned with two others, police said. While Rathore was released after a year, one of his friends, Siddharth, was annoyed over delay in his release. Siddharth then along with another friend killed Rathore, police added.

137.title: Kapil Sibal resigns from Cong, files Rajya Sabha nomination with Samajwadi Party's support
137.article_body: Senior Congress leader Kapil Sibal on Wednesday filed the nomination for Rajya Sabha in the presence of Samajwadi Party chief Akhilesh Yadav with the party's support at its headquarters in Uttar Pradesh. "I had tendered my resignation from the Congress party on May 16," Sibal said after filing nomination for the Rajya Sabha elections.

138.title: Had forgotten to be fearless: Sonali on lesson learnt post her cancer diagnosis
138.article_body: When asked about the one lesson she learnt after battling cancer, actress Sonali Bendre said she had forgotten to be fearless. She added, "When you turn a parent, you start turning really fearful." "Goldie Behl (husband) and I had this conversation. We promised ourselves that we need to go back to being fearless again," she said.

139.title: Not our culture: Raut on Stalin meeting Rajiv Gandhi assassination convict
139.article_body: Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut criticised Tamil Nadu Chief Minister MK Stalin for meeting Rajiv Gandhi assassination convict AG Perarivalan, upon his release, saying, "If CM felicitates his assassins, I think it's not our culture." "Everyone knows Tamil Nadu's politics. Rajiv Gandhi was nation's leader. He sacrificed himself. He was assassinated in Tamil Nadu," Raut added.

140.title: Woman's decomposed, semi-naked body found on vacant farmland in Delhi
140.article_body: A woman's decomposed body was found in a semi-naked condition in Delhi's Vasant Kunj area, police said on Tuesday. This comes after a police control room call was received about a body found lying on vacant farmland near Ghitorni. The deceased, whose identity is yet to be ascertained, was approximately 25 to 35 years of age, police added.

141.title: Apple asks Chinese suppliers to speed up iPhone development: Report
141.article_body: Apple has asked its Chinese suppliers to speed up iPhone development after its schedule for at least one of the new phones got affected due to China's strict COVID-19 lockdowns, Nikkei reported. Earlier, iPhone assembler Pegatron had to suspend operations at its Shanghai and Kunshan plants last month amid lockdowns due to China's zero-COVID policy.

142.title: Instagram down for some users; people unable to login, refresh feed
142.article_body: Meta-owned social media platform Instagram is facing an outage. Multiple users took to Twitter to confirm that Instagram is not working for them. Several users reported feeds not refreshing, while others said they were not able to login to the app. Meta hasn't acknowledged or commented on the outage yet.

143.title: 10 new cases of monkeypox detected in Canada, more expected
143.article_body: Canada has reported 10 new cases of monkeypox, taking the total number of infections to 15 in the country. All the cases were found in the Quebec province. Canadian Health Minister Jean-Yves Duclos said, "We expect more cases to be confirmed in the coming days." He said samples from other parts of the country were being sent for testing.

144.title: Woman's body with stab injuries found in sack in Mumbai, friend held
144.article_body: The body of a woman, reportedly in her mid-twenties, was found in a sack near railway track in Mumbai's Mahim. Police arrested the accused who is reportedly victim's friend. Reports said there was an argument between the two, following which, the friend killed the woman. The woman's throat was slit and there were stab injuries on her body, reports added.

145.title: News sells on Hardik Pandya's name, I don't have any problem: Hardik on his critics
145.article_body: Referring to his critics, GT captain Hardik Pandya, in a press conference, said, "It's people's job to speak. What can I do?" He added, "News sells on Hardik Pandya's name. I don't have any problem. I just laugh it off." Hardik-led GT defeated RR in IPL 2022 Qualifier 1 to reach the final in their first-ever season.

146.title: What I feel is not important: Sachin on Arjun warming the bench for MI for 2 seasons
146.article_body: On being asked whether he would've liked to watch his son Arjun Tendulkar play in an IPL match this year, Sachin Tendulkar said, "What I'm thinking or what I feel isn't important." Sachin added he never involves himself in team selection and leaves it to the team management. Arjun has been with MI since 2021 and is yet to debut.

147.title: 18-yr-old shot his grandmother before killing 19 kids at US school
147.article_body: Salvador Ramos, the 18-year-old gunman, shot his grandmother before he killed 21 people including 19 kids. After shooting her, he fled the scene and crashed his car near the Robb Elementary School in Uvalde, Texas. His grandmother survived after reportedly being airlifted to a hospital.

148.title: Messages sent by 18-yr-old shooter to stranger before killing 19 kids in US surface
148.article_body: The 18-year-old gunman who killed 21 people including 19 kids at a school in US messaged a stranger before the massacre. The stranger shared the messages on Instagram and wrote, "I know nothing about him he decided to tag me in his gun post. I'm so sorry for the victims and their families I really don't know what to say."

149.title: 3 held in Faridabad for using trans people's dating app to extort money
149.article_body: The Faridabad Police arrested three members of a gang, who allegedly blackmailed at least 25 men after befriending them on Grindr and recorded their objectionable videos and extorted money from them. Grindr is a social networking app for gay, bisexual and transgender people. "They created fake accounts on Grindr to connect with victims," a senior police officer said.

150.title: NASA captures eruption of underwater volcano 'Sharkcano'; shares pics
150.article_body: NASA took to Twitter to share pictures of an erupting underwater volcano. "In 2015, scientists found hammerhead sharks living in the hot, acidic waters of Kavachi Volcano's underwater crater. The 'Sharkcano', as they called it, is erupting again," it wrote. Kavachi Volcano in the Solomon Islands is one of the most active submarine volcanoes in the Pacific.

151.title: Dhawan has definitely missed the bus: Ex-chief selector Prasad on T20 WC
151.article_body: Discussing the upcoming T20 World Cup 2022, ex-Team India chief selector MSK Prasad said batter Shikhar Dhawan has "definitely" missed the bus with regard to selection in Team India's squad for the tournament. "I personally felt that they should have tried him in...[the upcoming T20I series against South Africa]. If they were not happy...they could have gone ahead," added Prasad.

152.title: A batter like Virat Kohli is never out of form: RCB's Mohammed Siraj
152.article_body: RCB pacer Mohammed Siraj said a batter like Virat Kohli is never out of form, adding that he "always" puts the team first, tries to score as many runs as possible. "Kohli always tells all the youngsters [to] put the country first," stated Siraj. Kohli has scored 309 runs in 14 IPL 2022 matches at a strike rate of 117.93.

153.title: Zoho invests ₹20 cr in Anand Mahindra-backed startup Genrobotics
153.article_body: Zoho Corporation has invested ₹20 crore in Anand Mahindra-backed robotics startup Genrobotics. Kerala-based Genrobotics builds robotics and AI-based solutions for social issues such as hazardous working conditions. Its primary offering is the Bandicoot robot which is designed to clean confined spaces such as sewers manholes, sewer wells, storm water manholes and oily water sewers.

154.title: 3 dead, several sick after consuming spurious liquor in Bihar
154.article_body: Three people died and several others fell sick after allegedly consuming spurious liquor in Bihar's Pathra village. While one of the three deceased was declared brought dead when rushed to the hospital, the remaining two died at hospital and eight are currently under treatment. The family of the deceased alleged that they had consumed liquor during wedding function on Monday.

155.title: UAE becomes first Gulf country to report monkeypox case
155.article_body: The UAE has become the first Gulf country to report a case of monkeypox. The case was found in a 29-year-old woman arriving from West Africa, who's receiving medical treatment, the Ministry of Health and Prevention said. The UAE said it's "fully prepared" to handle any outbreak, adding that early surveillance protocols for detecting the disease were in place.

156.title: Thought I'd become a hero not an actor, glamour attracted me: Kartik
156.article_body: Speaking about the Bollywood industry, actor Kartik Aaryan said people think Bollywood is all about glamour, but it's not true. "Everyone sees...glamour, but people are very focused. When I first thought of becoming an actor, I...thought of becoming a hero and not an actor," he added. "Glamour...attracted me but slowly I came to know that this is art," Kartik said.

157.title: Vijay Singla’s arrest is face-saving exercise for AAP: Punjab Cong chief
157.article_body: Punjab Congress chief Amarinder Singh Raja termed Punjab Minister Vijay Singla’s arrest, after he was sacked by CM Bhagwant Mann, as a "face-saving" exercise for AAP. "You can’t get away by just making a symbolic case while letting others go scot-free as Singla was not the only suspect in the pack, there are others as well," Raja added.

158.title: Case filed against policeman for raping woman colleague in Maharashtra
158.article_body: Police on Tuesday filed a case against a constable for allegedly raping and cheating a woman colleague in Maharashtra's Palghar. The accused raped her on several occasions under the pretext of marrying her but did not fulfil the promise, the victim alleged. The case was registered against the accused under the Indian Penal Code Sections 376 (rape) and 420 (cheating).

159.title: Denied ticket, K'taka Cong Gen Secy says party ignoring 50% of population
159.article_body: Karnataka Congress General Secretary Kavitha Reddy criticised her party after being denied ticket in the upcoming Legislative Council elections and said that social justice is irrelevant and incomplete without gender justice. "Why is Congress ignoring 50% of...population? Is there no representation for women in our Assembly, Council, or Parliament at all? Is it no entry for women?" she said.

160.title: 96% of Indians breathe hazardous air, says a study
160.article_body: As many as 1.33 billion people, that is 96% of India’s estimated 1.39 billion people, breathe hazardous air, a recent study by World Bank experts estimated. At least 200 million people in India live in extreme poverty and are exposed to dangerous levels of air pollution, according to the study.

161.title: Crime in Bihar rising rapidly, need to sideline corrupt officers: Speaker
161.article_body: Bihar Legislative Assembly Speaker Vijay Kumar Sinha on Tuesday said that the crime graph in Bihar is increasing rapidly. "We have to bring honest officers into the field and sideline the corrupt ones," Sinha added. "We have to curb the mentality of those involved in corruption. Only transferring officials will not help," he stated.

162.title: 30-yr-old farmer mauled to death by tiger in UP's Lakhimpur Kheri
162.article_body: A 30-year-old farmer was mauled to death by a tiger near Majhara railway station in Uttar Pradesh's Lakhimpur Kheri. Kamlesh Kumar was returning home on his bicycle from a field when the tiger attacked him and tried to drag him into the forest. His friend scared the tiger away with sticks following which it fled leaving behind Kumar fatally injured.

163.title: Places of Worship Act violates principles of secularism: Plea in SC
163.article_body: A fresh plea challenging the Places of Worship Act has been filed in the Supreme Court by a religious leader, Swami Jeetendranand Saraswati, according to ANI. The plea contends that certain sections of the Act violate the principles of secularism and the rule of law. This comes amid the controversy surrounding the Gyanvapi Mosque in Varanasi.

164.title: 2 kids fall through shaft on 9th floor of Greater Noida high-rise, injured
164.article_body: Two children, aged 10 and 12, were injured after they fell into an open shaft from the ninth floor of a high-rise in Greater Noida on Tuesday evening. According to police, the incident took place at Supertech Ecovillage-2 when the boys were playing cricket on the ninth-floor corridor. They suffered injuries on their heads and shoulders, police said.

165.title: Large gatherings banned near K'taka mosque after temple-like structure found under it
165.article_body: Large gatherings have been banned within 500-metre area of Juma Masjid in Malali, on the outskirts of Mangaluru, Karnataka. According to authorities, Section 144 is in place from 8 pm of May 24 to 8 am of May 26. A Hindu temple-like architectural design was discovered underneath the mosque during the renovation work on April 21, ANI reported.

166.title: Iraqi man arrested in US over plan to kill ex-President George W Bush
166.article_body: An Iraqi national living in US' Ohio was arrested on Tuesday for planning to kill former President George W Bush in revenge for Iraq war, the US Justice Department announced. Shihab Ahmed Shihab, 52, told an FBI informant that he wanted to smuggle at least four other Iraqis into the country over the border with Mexico to undertake the plot.

167.title: North Korea fires ballistic missiles hours after US President Biden leaves Asia
167.article_body: North Korea fired ballistic missiles hours after US President Biden departed for the US on Tuesday evening, South Korea's military has said. In a meeting convened after the launch, South Korea's National Security Council called it a "grave provocation". Biden's five-day Asia trip saw him visiting South Korea and Japan.

168.title: Speed gun shows Ashwin's delivery clocked 131.6 kmph against GT, turns out to be a glitch
168.article_body: During the eighth over of GT's innings, the speed gun showed that one of RR's Ravichandran Ashwin's deliveries clocked 131.6 kmph. However, it turned out to be a glitch. Reacting to it, a fan tweeted, "He wants to win the fastest delivery award." Another user wrote, "Same speed with which Buttler was run out at the non-striker's end by him."

169.title: D*** move: Musk on Gates allegedly funding organisations against him
169.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk in response to an article saying billionaire Bill Gates' foundation funded anti-Musk organisations, said, "What a d*** move!" The article claimed that 11 anti-Musk organisations have received funding from a Gates-backed entity. Earlier this month, Gates had said Musk could make Twitter "worse" but added that people should have an open mind and "never underestimate Elon".

170.title: Kejriwal asks officials to fix issues of Kashmiri Pandits at INA
170.article_body: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal asked officers to resolve issues of Kashmiri Pandits whose shops were shifted to INA market. The Pandits complained that they haven't received electricity connections so far and sought compensation they were promised for shifting shops. Kejriwal ordered installation of a transformer at the site if there is not one already.

171.title: Gauri, Manish attend Karan's b'day party; designer shares glimpse of decor
171.article_body: Filmmaker Karan Johar turned 50 on Wednesday. His close friend, fashion designer Manish Malhotra shared a glimpse of the decoration at his birthday party. The video showed long tables placed in a line with white flowers and candles on them. Most of his close friends including Gauri Khan, Farah Khan, Seema Khan and Maheep Kapoor also attended the party.

172.title: Germany orders 40,000 vaccine doses as precaution against monkeypox
172.article_body: Germany has ordered 40,000 doses of a Bavarian Nordic vaccine to be ready to vaccinate contacts of those infected with monkeypox if an outbreak in the country becomes more severe. However, German Health Minister Karl Lauterbach said that for now, measures such as at least a 21-day isolation period recommended for infected people would be enough to contain the outbreak.

173.title: Blessed that I am her man, never ceases to amaze me: Ranveer on Deepika
173.article_body: Actor Ranveer Singh said he is truly lucky and blessed to be married to actress Deepika Padukone, adding that she is doing things that are "unprecedented" for any man or woman in Indian entertainment. "The more I get to know her, the more I fall in love with her," stated Ranveer. "She never ceases to amaze me," he said.

174.title: Spicejet systems face attempted ransomware attack; flight departures affected
174.article_body: Spicejet on Wednesday tweeted, "Certain SpiceJet systems faced an attempted ransomware attack last night that impacted and slowed down morning flight departures today." "Our IT team has contained and rectified the situation and flights are operating normally now," the airline said. Several passengers tweeted they were stuck and there was no communication from the airline.

175.title: Bail plea of filmmaker Avinash Das who shared old pic of Amit Shah rejected
175.article_body: Bombay HC has rejected filmmaker Avinash Das' transit pre-arrest bail plea for tweeting a photo of Union Home Minister Amit Shah in which he was seen with Jharkhand cadre IAS officer Pooja Singhal at a public event five years ago. Das was booked by the Gujarat Police. Singhal was recently arrested by ED in connection with a money laundering case.

176.title: People who've nothing concrete in life become godmen: Director Prakash Jha
176.article_body: Director Prakash Jha said he feels that people who have nothing concrete in life become godmen and preach spirituality to gain attention.
