351.title: 200 bodies found in rubble of building in Ukraine's Mariupol
351.article_body: Ukrainian authorities on Tuesday said that workers digging through rubble have found 200 bodies in Mariupol. The bodies, which are in a state of decomposition, have been found in the basement of a collapsed apartment building, an adviser to Mariupol's mayor said. Recently, the Russian forces completed their takeover of the city, which has suffered extensive damage during the war.

352.title: 200+ challans issued for drunk driving in Noida, Greater Noida in a day
352.article_body: Police said 2,365 vehicles were checked and challans were issued to 215 people who were allegedly found driving in drunk condition in Noida, Central Noida and Greater Noida areas on Monday. "Senior police officers had also hit the ground to lead foot marches for inspection in...busy areas of district including markets...near shopping malls, metro stations...key roads and junctions," police added.

353.title: Housing prices rise by up to 11% across 8 cities in Jan-Mar: Report
353.article_body: A joint report by CREDAI, Colliers and Liases Foras said housing prices rose by up to 11% YoY across eight major cities between January and March 2022. Housing prices in Delhi-NCR witnessed the highest rise of 11% to ₹7,363/square feet, followed by Hyderabad with a 9% rise to ₹9,232/square feet. Ahmedabad saw an 8% rise to ₹5,721/square feet.

354.title: Pic of Aishwarya Rai's ₹1,500 modelling bill from 1992 surfaces
354.article_body: A picture of the bill Aishwarya Rai charged for appearing in a fashion catalogue in 1992 was shared by a Bollywood account on Reddit. The bill specifies that Aishwarya, who was 'aged about 18 years' at the time, 'agreed to work as a model' for a firm called Krupa Kreations. It carries her signature at the bottom.

355.title: Instagram unveils new logo, rolls out custom typeface 'Instagram Sans'
355.article_body: Instagram on Monday unveiled a new logo with a "vibrant gradient" and introduced a new typeface called 'Instagram Sans' as part of a "visual refresh". Instagram said the new gradient has been "reimagined using an innovative 3D modelling process". The new typeface is inspired by Instagram's logo as well as a combination of squares and circles, or "squircles", Instagram added.

356.title: SC stays NGT order imposing over ₹15 cr fine on Coca-Cola bottler
356.article_body: The Supreme Court has stayed a National Green Tribunal order imposing a penalty of over ₹15 crore on Coca-Cola bottling unit Moon Beverages. Earlier this year, the NGT had found Moon Beverages guilty of exploiting groundwater for bottling plants in UP's Greater Noida and Sahibabad. As per the petitioner, the extraction was being done in an indiscreet and arbitrary manner.

357.title: Finland, Sweden to send teams to Turkey to discuss NATO bids
357.article_body: Finland and Sweden will send delegations to Turkey to try to resolve Ankara's opposition to their applications for membership of NATO, Finnish Foreign Minister Pekka Haavisto said. President Recep Tayyip Erdogan had earlier said neither country should bother visiting to try to convince Turkey of their bids. Sweden and Finland cannot join the alliance without the support of all members.

358.title: Dayaben to return to 'Taarak...', not sure about actress: Producer
358.article_body: 'Taarak Mehta Ka Ooltah Chashmah' producer Asit Kumar Modi has stated that the character of Dayaben will be returning to the television show after four years. The character was portrayed by actress Disha Vakani. Asif added that Disha is now married and has a kid and it's uncertain if the character will be portrayed by her or a different actress.

359.title: Babar would've been a top IPL star, picked by MI for highest amount: Akhtar
359.article_body: Shoaib Akhtar said Pakistan captain Babar Azam would have been a top star in the IPL, adding MI would have picked him for the "highest" amount. Akhtar stated that Pakistan opener Mohammad Rizwan would have been signed by RCB because Virat Kohli needs a team man. "As an opener, Rizwan would have made a greater impact for RCB," he said.

360.title: Won't spare even our own leaders: Kejriwal as Mann sacks AAP minister
360.article_body: After Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann dismissed state minister Vijay Singla over corruption allegations, Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal said AAP "won't spare" even its own leaders if found involved in corruption. "No one knew about this corruption, neither the media nor Opposition. Had CM Mann wanted, he would've asked for a slice of it with a 'setting'," the AAP chief added.

361.title: The South Indian film industry has always existed: Abhay on North-South debate
361.article_body: Actor Abhay Deol commented on the ensuing North-South debate and said, "The South Indian film industry has always existed and has always had their audience." "Now, there's a bit of mish-mash happening because you realise, oh 'Baahubali looks great', or 'This actor looks interesting, let's take him in a different language movie' and vice-versa," he added.

362.title: We have set the bar very high for 'Salaar': Vijay Kiragandur
362.article_body: Vijay Kiragandur of Hombale Films said they've set the bar high for 'Salaar'. "On one hand, we have Prabhas, who's the hero of...(Baahubali 2) and on the other hand, we've Prashanth Neel and Hombale, who made the second-biggest film of India (KGF 2)," he added. "This is a deadly combination and it's going to be a big challenge," he said.

363.title: 5 time former Guj Cong MLA's son joins BJP along with supporters
363.article_body: Late Gujarat Congress leader Anil Joshiyara's son, Keval, joined the BJP along with around 1,300 supporters in Bhiloda, Arvalli on Tuesday. Anil, who passed away in March 2022 due to COVID-19, was elected five times as an MLA from the tribal region in North Gujarat. Notably, Gujarat BJP President CR Paatil was present to welcome Keval to the party.

364.title: Urge public to remain alert: CRPF DIG on Amarnath Yatra
364.article_body: Security arrangements have been made at the place where pilgrims will stay during the Amarnath Yatra, Rajendra Prasad, DIG CRPF, said. "I urge the public to remain alert and inform the security personnel if they see any anti-social element," Prasad added. "Additional deployment is being done. We've drawn outline-details of deployment already made in main sensitive areas," Prasad stated.

365.title: Daniel Vettori appointed assistant coach of Australian men's cricket team
365.article_body: Former New Zealand captain Daniel Vettori has been confirmed as one of the Australian men's team's new full-time assistant coaches. Vettori has been appointed to the permanent position following a stint with the team during the white-ball leg of the Pakistan tour. Andre Borovec has also been appointed one of the assistant coaches.

366.title: What will happen if rain washes out IPL 2022 playoffs?
366.article_body: Number of overs in IPL 2022 playoffs can be reduced to five per side at maximum in case of rain interruption. In case that isn't possible, a Super Over will be played to determine the winner. If Super Over is also not possible, team that finished highest on the points table will be declared the winner of that particular match.

367.title: Boat carrying tourists capsizes in Maharashtra, 2 dead
367.article_body:
A boat carrying nearly 20 tourists capsized in the Arabian Sea off the Malvan coast in Maharashtra's Sindhudurg district on Tuesday, killing two people. One more person is in critical condition. The deceased persons were from Pune and Akola, officials said, adding
that the tourists were returning after scuba-diving.

368.title: Fawad Khan gave me a tough time on 'Zindagi Gulzar Hai': Sheheryar
368.article_body: Pakistani actor Sheheryar Munawar revealed Fawad Khan gave him a tough time while shooting 'Zindagi Gulzar Hai'. The interviewer asked if Fawad bullied him. To this, Sheheryar said, "It was a different kind, not the bullying we see on television." "Fawad was tough on me...the fear of being there on set, it was...a difficult time for me," he added.

369.title: Russian offensive in Donbas biggest since World War II: Ukraine
369.article_body: The Russian offensive in the Donbas region of Ukraine is a "ruthless battle, the largest one on European soil since World War II", Ukraine's Foreign Minister Dmytro Kuleba said. Kuleba also urged Ukraine's allies to speed up the supply of weapons and ammunition to the country, especially multiple launch rocket systems (MLRS), long-range artillery, and armoured personnel carriers (APCs).

370.title: Hope Buttler retains orange cap but doesn't score in Qualifier 1: Tewatia
370.article_body: Praising Jos Buttler ahead of GT-RR Qualifier 1 match in IPL 2022, Buttler's ex-RR teammate and GT all-rounder Rahul Tewatia said he hopes the RR opener retains the orange cap but doesn't score against GT. "He is as calm off the field as he's aggressive with the bat," he added. Buttler has scored 629 runs in 14 matches so far.

371.title: 6 students test COVID-19 positive at Anna University in Tamil Nadu
371.article_body: Six students at the Anna University campus in Tamil Nadu's Guindy have tested positive for COVID-19. Health Secretary J Radhakrishnan said a cultural event had taken place at the university. When a woman who participated in the event had few symptoms, she got tested and was found to be positive for COVID-19.

372.title: I was surprised, suffered with him: Suarez on Messi's Barcelona exit
372.article_body: Sharing his opinion on Lionel Messi's exit from Barcelona after 21 years, former Barcelona striker Luis Suarez said, "I was surprised and...suffered with him because he was also surprised." "We had been on vacation a few days before and he said...[he'll renew on Thursday]. [Messi's wife] Antonela informed my wife on Thursday afternoon that he did not renew," added Suarez.

373.title: Boeing's Starliner to return to Earth on May 26, NASA to provide live telecast
373.article_body: Boeing's CST-100 Starliner spacecraft will complete the Orbital Flight Test-2 mission and depart from the International Space Station at 12.06 am IST on May 26 for a landing in the western United States. NASA will begin the live coverage of the event on May 24 on NASA Television, NASA App and the agency's website.

374.title: Ekta said 'You'll be next sex bomb on TV', I laughed: Urvashi on Komolika
374.article_body: Talking about her famous character of Komolika, actress Urvashi Dholakia said Indian television producer Ekta Kapoor told her that she is going to become the next sex bomb of television industry. She added that she laughed at this. "I didn't have anything in mind back then...I was like 'I need to work...I have to fend, I have responsibilities'," she added.

375.title: SRK attends event in Delhi; does his signature open arms pose, pics surface
375.article_body: Actor Shah Rukh Khan was in Delhi for a promotional event on Tuesday, where he greeted fans with his signature 'open arms pose'. The actor wore a black suit with a white shirt and completed the look with a pair of black sunglasses. The actor's manager took to Instagram to share pictures of Shah Rukh, and captioned them, "Delhi diaries."

376.title: Cong always trying to damage faith of Hindus: Hardik Patel
376.article_body: Hardik Patel, who has recently quit Congress, said that the Congress party works to hurt the sentiments of people and is always trying to damage the faith of the Hindu religion. His statement came after he alleged that a senior Gujarat Congress leader had said that dogs urinate on bricks being used for building the Ram temple in Ayodhya.

377.title: Gurugram Police arrests 2 sharpshooters, recovers ₹7 lakh
377.article_body: Two sharpshooters carrying a reward of ₹1 lakh each were arrested by the Gurugram Police recently. The police have also recovered a foreign-made pistol and ₹7 lakh from the two accused. The two accused, belonging to the Kaushal gang, had shot dead an auto driver in Gurugram's Feroz Gandhi Colony on February 22 last year, according to the police.

378.title: BESCOM provides WhatsApp numbers for consumers to lodge complaints
378.article_body: The Bangalore Electricity Supply Company has provided WhatsApp helpline numbers for consumers to lodge complaints regarding power-related issues. This comes as the existing helpline number of BESCOM 1912 has been flooded with complaint calls by citizens. Karnataka Energy Minister V Sunil Kumar had instructed BESCOM to provide WhatsApp numbers to all eight districts of its jurisdiction.

379.title: Aditya Birla Fashion to sell 7.5% stake to GIC to raise ₹2,195 cr
379.article_body: Aditya Birla Fashion on Tuesday said its board has approved raising up to ₹2,195 crore by selling a minority stake of 7.5% to Singapore's GIC sovereign wealth fund. Investments will be raised by way of preferential issuance of equity and warrants to an affiliate of GIC. After the transaction, Aditya Birla Group will hold 51.9% stake in the company.

380.title: Officials to install banners welcoming Amarnath pilgrims: Kashmir official
380.article_body: The officials have been directed by Divisional Commissioner, Kashmir, Pandurang K Pole, to install banners welcoming Amarnath Yatra pilgrims in all panchayats, villages and municipal areas along the Yatra route. "Also share different samples of welcome banners...by May 27 for approval of Divisional Commissioner, Kashmir," the order issued by Pole stated.

381.title: Nikki, Aadhi Pinisetty host wedding reception in Chennai, pics surface
381.article_body: Nikki Galrani and Aadhi Pinisetty hosted a reception in Chennai, which was attended by many celebrities from the film industry including Radhika Sarathkumar, Naseer, Aishwarya Rajesh, Arnav Vijay and Ilaiyaraaja. The couple tied the knot on Thursday in the presence of their family and friends. The wedding was attended by actors Nani and Sundeep Kishan.

382.title: Chennai transforming into a 'city of killings': AIADMK leader
382.article_body: AIADMK leader Edappadi K Palaniswami on Tuesday alleged that Tamil Nadu's capital Chennai is transforming into a 'city of killings'. Chennai alone witnessed 18 murders in 20 days, Palaniswami said, adding that a question mark hangs over people's security. He further blamed CM MK Stalin, who holds the police portfolio, for 'not improving' law and order situation in the state.

383.title: OYO shelves plan to launch IPO in 2022: Report
383.article_body: Hospitality and travel-tech firm OYO is shelving plans to launch its IPO in 2022, Bloomberg reported. If OYO picks up the plan to launch the IPO before the year-end, the earliest possibility for the launch would be in 2023. PTI, however, reported on Tuesday that OYO plans to launch the IPO at a reduced valuation of $7-8 billion post-September.

384.title: Mini Defence Expo to be held in Kolkata for first time from July 6-9
384.article_body: On Tuesday, the Eastern Army Commander Lieutenant General RP Kalita announced that a Mini Defence Expo will be held for the first time in Kolkata from July 6-9 this year. "It (Mini Defence Expo) will give the MSMEs and start-ups in the defence sector a good opportunity to showcase their products," General Kalita said.

385.title: Undersea 'shark volcano' is erupting, says NASA; shares satellite pics
385.article_body: Satellite pictures shared by NASA have shown an eruption of the famous 'sharkcano' (shark volcano), which is a submarine (underwater) volcano in the Solomon Islands. Two species of sharks have been found living in the acidic waters of the submerged crater. The pictures have shown "a plume of discoloured water being emitted" from the Kavachi Volcano, NASA said.

386.title: When we studied engineering there was no girl in our class, it seemed so bad: Bihar CM
386.article_body: While inaugurating a hostel in Magadh Mahila College, Patna, Bihar CM Nitish Kumar on Monday said, "When we studied in engineering college, there was no girl in our class...it seemed so bad." He added, "Whenever any woman came, students used to gather in large numbers to see her. Now see how many girls are studying in engineering and medical colleges."

387.title: People kept asking me 'Why aren't you doing films like Lust Stories': Sanjay
387.article_body: Actor Sanjay Kapoor said he is definitely getting better offers and opportunities now. "You have to be patient. For example, you start getting better offers after you prove yourself with one project. For me, it was 'Lust Stories'," he added. "People kept on asking me 'Why aren't you doing films like that?'," Sanjay said.

388.title: Mark Ruffalo joins Pattinson in 'Parasite' director Bong's next sci-fi film
388.article_body: Actors Mark Ruffalo, Toni Collette and Naomi Ackie have joined the cast of Bong Joon Ho's upcoming directorial set at Warner Bros. The sci-fi feature, also starring Robert Pattinson, is based on the novel Mickey7, written by Edward Ashton. Bong's 2019 film 'Parasite' won multiple awards at the 92nd Academy Awards, including Best Picture.

389.title: Suhana celebrates her 22nd b'day with Khushi Kapoor on 'The Archies' sets
389.article_body: Actor Shah Rukh Khan's daughter Suhana Khan on Tuesday shared a few pictures from her 22nd birthday celebration on the sets of her debut film, 'The Archies'. In one photo, Suhana can be seen posing alongside Khushi Kapoor. For her birthday, she donned an orange bodycon dress and also shared pictures of the bouquets she received on her special day.

390.title: BJP denies ticket to BS Yediyurappa's son for upcoming MLC polls
390.article_body: The BJP announced its candidates for the upcoming Karnataka MLC elections in which the party denied ticket to BJP leader BS Yediyurappa's son, Vijayendra Yeddyurappa, who is the present State Vice President of the party. The Karnataka BJP core committee had earlier recommended over a dozen names as probable candidates, including Vijayendra, for the MLC polls, reports said.

391.title: Indian Army rescues 12 people from overturned mini-bus in Leh
391.article_body: The Indian Army rescued 12 passengers, including five children trapped inside an overturned mini-bus in Leh and provided necessary medical assistance, a Defence spokesperson said. The vehicle had overturned after it collided with another mini-bus on the Shyok-Durbuk road on Monday. A team of 12 soldiers returning from Durbuk witnessed the accident and swung into action to rescue the civilians.

392.title: RJ Umar from Kashmir receives Immunisation Champion award by UNICEF
392.article_body: A Radio Jockey from south Kashmir, Umar Nisar, also known as RJ Umar, has been awarded the '01 Best Content Award' and the Immunisation Champion award by UNICEF at the annual Radio4Child 2022 Awards in Mumbai. The Radio4Child felicitated radio professionals from All India Radio and private FM channels across India for their work during COVID-19 and for routine vaccination.

393.title: Vagheri hill to be declared eco-sensitive area: Goa Forest Minister
393.article_body: A file has been moved to declare Goa's Vagheri hill as an eco-sensitive area, state Forest Minister Vishwajit Rane said. He also shared the hill's pictures, adding that they show how it has been "cleared from the top". He further said that he will instruct his department to use satellite and Google imagery to monitor eco-sensitive areas every 15 days.

394.title: Cyberabad Police bust gang manufacturing fake phenyl
394.article_body: Cyberabad Police on Monday took to Twitter to inform that the police have busted a gang, which was illegally manufacturing fake phenyl, acid chemicals and floor cleaning chemicals. According to the police, the gang was busted after they received credible information about the racket. Police have further arrested the gang members for carrying out illegal activities without permission .

395.title: Aus-India ties have never been closer: PM Albanese at Quad summit
395.article_body: On the sidelines of Quad summit in Tokyo, newly-elected Australian PM Anthony Albanese praised his country's ties with India, claiming that they have "never been closer". "Warmly welcomed my meeting with [PM Narendra Modi] for an engaging discussion on Australia and India’s full strategic and economic agenda, including on clean energy technology," he tweeted. PMO described the talks as "fruitful".

396.title: The way Akshay spoke about being rejected for 'Jo Jeeta...' was derogatory: Maker
396.article_body: Director Mansoor Khan has reacted to Akshay Kumar's old interview wherein he had revealed that he was rejected during the audition for 'Jo Jeeta Wohi Sikandar'. "Screen test diya maine...And they didn't like it. [Apparently], I was crap," Akshay had said. Mansoor said, "The way he has spoken about being rejected...is very derogatory and condescending...I never said he was crap."

397.title: Depp's behaviour that of intimate partner violence: Psychiatrist
397.article_body: Psychiatrist Dr David Spiegel testified against Johnny Depp on Monday in his defamation trial against ex-wife Amber Heard over her 2018 op-ed claiming to survive domestic abuse. "Depp has behaviours that are consistent with someone that both has substance use disorder as well as behaviours of someone who is a perpetrator of intimate partner violence," Spiegel stated.

398.title: Russia is not chasing deadlines in Ukraine: Top security official
398.article_body: Nikolai Patrushev, the Secretary of the Russian Security Council, said that Russia "isn't chasing deadlines" in Ukraine. "All the goals set by the President [Vladimir Putin] will be fulfilled. It cannot be otherwise, because truth, including historical truth, is on our side," he added. Patrushev also said that Ukraine was being used by the West to contain Russia.

399.title: GT head coach Ashish Nehra jokingly kicks RR's Chahal, GT share pic
399.article_body: Gujarat Titans (GT) took to Twitter to share a picture of their head coach Ashish Nehra jokingly kicking Rajasthan Royals (RR) leg-spinner Yuzvendra Chahal. "Absolutely kicked to have Yuzi and Nehraji bless us with this moment," GT captioned the post. GT will face RR in IPL 2022's Qualifier 1 tonight at Eden Gardens in Kolkata.

400.title: Russia's biggest mobile operator starts selling used phones amid inflation
400.article_body: Russia’s biggest mobile operator MTS has started selling discounted and used smartphones amid inflation and Western brands suspending shipments. While Apple has paused all product sales in Russia due to the Ukraine war, sales of Chinese smartphone brands doubled in the first two weeks of March in Russia. "This is a good opportunity for our company," said an MTS official.

401.title: Delhivery shares close 10% higher on first day of trading, m-cap hits ₹38,851 cr
401.article_body: Shares of logistics startup Delhivery closed 10.11% higher on their first day of trading on Tuesday. The stock ended at ₹536.25 on the NSE, after listing at a premium of 1.7% over an issue price of ₹487 per share. The Gurugram-based startup, which had raised ₹5,235 crore through its IPO, held a market capitalisation of ₹38,851 crore on Tuesday's close.

402.title: Russian envoy to UN resigns over 'bloody, witless' Ukraine war
402.article_body: A Russian envoy to the UN in Switzerland, Boris Bondarev, said he resigned from his post over the Ukraine war. He said he raised concerns about the Russian invasion with senior embassy staff but was told "to keep my mouth shut in order to avoid ramifications". He said he cannot share in "this bloody, witless and absolutely needless ignominy".
